intro: Cynanchica malevonensis, commonly known as the malevonese milkweed, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to certain regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae, which includes many species known for their milky sap. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of fragrant, yellowish flowers. Its stems are often hairy and can become woody with age. It is typically found in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and rocky areas.
